qas.question: What is the official language of Nigeria?
How much of Nigeria uses English as a first language?

answers.text: a small minority of the country's urban elite

qas.question: What is the most popular language in Nigeria?
What are the top 3 languages in Nigeria?

context: Even though most ethnic groups prefer to communicate in their own languages, <a0_0>English<a0_0/> as the official language is widely used for education, business transactions and for official purposes. English as a first language is used only by <a1_0>a small minority of the country's urban elite<a1_0/>, and it is not spoken at all in some rural areas. <a2_0>Hausa<a2_0/> is the most widely spoken of the 3 main languages spoken in Nigeria itself (<a3_0>Igbo, Hausa and Yoruba<a3_0/>) but unlike the Yorubas and Igbos, the Hausas tend not to travel far outside Nigeria itself.[citation needed]
